website_summaries.verdict: Designed for the traveler who expects top performance without sacrificing style. Extremely durable and loaded with features.
pros: Features twin heavy-duty wheels for smooth rolling
Aluminum extension handle has 4 stops for comfort
Stylish with leather accents and practical with a built-in exterior USB port
Deluxe interior tie-down system and accessory pockets for easy access during travel

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke first time I used it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a similar and MUCH LESS EXPENSIVE carry-on bag for several years which, although not as chic in appearance, has performed flawlessly for many many years. I decided to upgrade to a more expensive bag with this TravelPro Platinum Elite and WARNING, you do not get what you pay for. The zipper on the outside pocket broke the first time I used the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sagehen

customer_reviews.title: Attractive - but the front pocket zipper broke during my third weekend trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was recommended on Wirecutter and really liked the color. It held a lot, and everything packed well. Then the zipper for the front pocket broke during my third short trip using the bag. The bag had always been in my control and was never at the mercy of baggage handlers. (That is why I bought a carry on!) Luckily, I was still in my return window and sent it back to Amazon as defective. Now I have to figure out what to buy instead.
customer_reviews.author: Takoma Kate

customer_reviews.title: Suiter too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably classy look and quality construction. 3 stars because the suiter is too narrow. Had to scrunch up the shoulders of my 40L coat to get it to fit, which defeats the purpose. Purchased this as a replacement for an older TravelPro but had to return. Sad about that because it really does have a refined look. Went with a Victorinox Werks 5.0 instead, which pushes the limits for allowable carry on size, but its suiter accommodates the shoulders of a men’s sport coat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap product
customer_reviews.text: I spent money on this bag because it’s marketed as a bag that flight attendants use - frequent travelers. I bought one in November 2018 and had to return it immediately because a zipper broke the first time we used it. I re-ordered another one hoping it was a fluke. 2 zippers have broken during the 3 times I’ve traveled with this bag. The main zipper and the larger front zipper. Total crap product. Not worth the money in any way. This bag is falling apart and we’ve used it 3 times since November.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zipper for outside pocket broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Travelpro suitcase, so I was very disappointed that the zipper to the outside pocket broke the first time I tried to take this suitcase on a trip. I saw that another reviewer had the same issue. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: John Wu

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Had to retire my old carry on. Had a flight crew member recommend Travelpro two wheel and I am glad he did. Just took my first trip with it and does it ever pull easy. The zipper construction is built to last (first thing I look at). Love the way the handle is curved to fit in your hand. The suitor works well. The comments about it being narrow for suits are accurate but for a carry on it is fine. Held my pressed shirts well and they kept their shape. Overall very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Gothberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, high-quality luggage, backed by warranty
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my 2nd travelpro, 18 years after my first one that I dragged around the world several times. I went for the best I could find, and this was it. Has excellent internal storage for toiletries (long enough for toothbrushes!!), suits, and multiple pockets and even the ability to expand slightly. Includes great wheels, handle, and very high-quality zippers to close everything. I really can't say anything bad about this luggage. It is more expensive than the cheap stuff, but worth every penny if you travel a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Whitacre

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, but you’ll be sending it back.
customer_reviews.text: The suitcase itself looks nice. However, after 2 uses its already falling apart. The zipper on mine broke, and the material started to tear. I’m sending back ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made; Not quite small enuf for all int’l carriers
customer_reviews.text: Love how close this is to my old 22” in size and proportion while still fitting most airline size standards for carry on. I do wish there was a size just an inch or two smaller each way (but not super small underwear size) so it would go on all of the Asian carriers as well. This will probably have to be checked on budget carriers. Quality seems great, especially wheels. Classy and stylish. Wish there was a large 2 wheel version to go with. I had to buy a separate TravelPro line for my larger checked bag so my fins would fit! It looks fine but would like nicer if it totally matched.
customer_reviews.author: skyye

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this suitcase as it had great reviews. I have used it 3 times since getting it for Xmas 2018, and the outter-most zipper already broke. So the rest is still usable...It's a good size and otherwise seems sturdy, but the zipper break is just really disappointing, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lynne Kloster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one or two nights.
customer_reviews.text: I travel for work and frequently end up on commuter flights that have limited overhead space. This case fits anywhere and holds my workout sneakers, two days of clothes, and my toiletries without being crowded. When it arrived I thought NO WAY was this going to hold what I needed, but it proved me wrong. It wheels easily and is stable with a large loaded backpack on top. Love it. I have 3 pieces of TravelPro luggage and I love every one of them. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: The KGB

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is non existent - so forget about any guarantee
customer_reviews.text: The product broke within 1 week of use. I’ve called their customer support, but they keep you on hold for hours. I’ve emailed them and left messages and have yet to receive any response after 7 failed attempts. I trusted wirecutter review on this and have been let down badly. Maybe some of their bags are sturdy enough to take normal travel abuse but if they have one that isn’t you can forget about their warranty because they won’t Respond to any attempt to reach them. Sadly I’m going to try and seek recourse through the BBB and maybe Amazon. In the very least it will serve as a warning to other customers.
customer_reviews.author: IJR

customer_reviews.title: Holding up very well
customer_reviews.text: We were in the market to purchase new luggage. Our first set us of luggage as a married couple over 15 years ago was a 3-piece Samsonite set purchased from Sam's Club. Over the years we continued to follow this pattern or purchasing, but realized that quality was severely declining...while the price point was increasing. We reviewed higher end Samsonite luggage sets, but could never quite embrace their product. We also checked out Tumi, and decided it was not worth the price point. Travelpro's quality, craftsmanship, and warranty won us over. We also have the 26", and planning to purchase the 29". Definitely a recommended purchase (p.s. I am not a bot, I am a real person! Roll Tide!!)
customer_reviews.author: James Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Unable to return!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these luggage’s based on its review. Unfortunately I didn’t realize the zipper was broken. They are not easy to maneuver when around the airport. It does fit more than the average carry-on luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and features
customer_reviews.text: After many years of being "off the road" I am back in a role requiring 60%+ travel. I bought this because Travelpro has an excellent reputation, and so far I am not disappointed. Adaptable (the "suiter" section is handy when traveling with an extra sport coat or two). The criticism that the suiter isn't wide enough for the shoulders of a coat is valid, but it can't be wider that the rollaboard is tall, so I'm not sure how Travelpro could solve that. Well thought out and well made, durable piece of luggage suitable for a road warrior.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous bag!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, stunning color and appearance, love the extra storage for toiletries, well constructed, very sturdy and durable. I purchased one for our son as well since he will be traveling with his new job and he just loves it too. It's the perfect bag!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of broken zippers and an aching arm from pulling an awkward roller board so treated myself to this Travel Pro. I’ve taken six flights already with the new bag and have found it has great features,a removable toiletries bag and great mesh pockets on compression strap that make packing and unpacking easier. Well constructed and the curved Handel makes for less wrist strain while moving through airports or up and over a curb.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Sweeper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a 10-year-old Platinum 5 bag with a zillion miles. Pluses: a great looking bag and lite. Negatives: while supposed to be of similar size, the interior is actually a bit smaller, the exterior fabric is not as robust, and the zippers are larger and more exposed (can partially hide on the 5) and begging to be ripped off if having to check. Will return and continue to either search or rebuild my existing bag.
customer_reviews.author: Farm1957

customer_reviews.title: Still a great bag, but a little more cramped than my last iteration
customer_reviews.text: The Travel Pro Platinum Élite is still a good, sturdy and durable bag. My only disappointment is that there seems to be a little less room than the same bag I bought four years ago, partly due to only a partial expansion wedge rather than a full size expansion. For the price this is still a great bag and is not overly heavy before starting to pack. I think it is the best value bag in this size.
customer_reviews.author: Teleskipilot

customer_reviews.title: The size provided by the manufacturer is misleading.
customer_reviews.text: This piece of luggage was presented by TravelPro as equivalent in size to a “Platinum 3” TravelPro 22” Roll-A-Board Expandable Suiter Suitcase that I had purchased earlier, yet the Travelpro Platinum Elite 22” Expandable Carry-on Rollaboard Suiter Suitcase is at least an inch in height less than my “Platinum 3” TravelPro 22” Suitcase. How did 22" in height shrink? The quality of the Travelpro Platinum Elite 22” Expandable Carry-on Rollaboard Suiter Suitcase is way down from what TravelPro produced a decade ago. TravelPro is not the company they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good garment perk.
customer_reviews.text: I only carried one suit and 6 shirts in the garment section. I was careful how I folded the suit and I pulled each shirt side completely across the body and folded the sleeves across each other. I never had to iron the suit nor the shirts to wear them. I probably would have gotten two suits in if I were able to place the shirts in the body of the bag but I had other items to put there. Al & all I was amassed as to how much I was able to bring for a 10 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: walter j teper

customer_reviews.title: Best luggage on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best soft sided luggage in the market for the frequent traveler it’s the highest quality that I have found it has many features that other luggage does not including interior features for securing your packed items etc. I highly recommend this luggage to anyone seeking the best!
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Starts with Broken Zipper
customer_reviews.text: I have been very disappointed in the quality of the luggage. I needed it for an emergency trip sis was unable to return when it arrives with an exterior zipper that was broken. I believed the reviews I read and didn’t want to spend over $300 to get another brand that I’ve had for 10+ years with few complaints. If you’re looking at this, keep looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Melodie Grace

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy that I spent the extra money and made the investment to purchase the Travelpro Platinum! The first use was on a trip to New Orleans. Fit in the overhead bin and was easy to wheel around! NO TIPPING troubles!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B. Callahan

customer_reviews.title: My wife likes it. All that matters.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this one is hard to beat. As you know you can a get a carry on for less than $100, or spend $440. Makes it hard to determine value. I chose this one and my wife likes it. That’s all that maters to me in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HutchyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Only TWO wheels not four
customer_reviews.text: Not as described and pictured on the amazon site (or on the NYT's product recommendations page). Suitcase arrived with two wheels not four - very annoying since the whole reason I ordered it was I wanted a spinner. Going right back.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous of course

customer_reviews.title: Love that it doesn't tip over fully loaded!
customer_reviews.text: We took this Platinum Elite and a TravelPro Crew on a 10 day trip to Europe - the Platinum has a slightly wider base and stays upright. The Crew kept tipping over so we returned it for a 2nd Platinum. I really like that the front exterior accordian-style pocket opens wide - great to stuff a jacket or shoes. The built-in Suiter and using packing tubes really maximize what you can pack. We were at 18kg/40 lbs fully loaded. This is the max size I would consider for luggage - the bigger spinners can get overweight quickly and are way too difficult to maneuver up stairs, down city streets, etc. The wheels are awesome - roll very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelle L. Winn

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and well-designed suitcase
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. It replaced another brand-name suitcase that had 12 years and many miles on it. The TravelPro bag is well appointed, balanced, rolls very easily and has great capacity. I’m very glad to have acquired this suitcase for business and leisure travel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: TravelPro delivers consistency.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for smaller regional overhead bins and aisle width. Also fits under the seat. Best warranty ever! Holds enough for a 3 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Gymfly

customer_reviews.title: light and well thought out
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a 22" bag I had used for years, and now realize I should have replaced it long ago. This Travelpro rolls great, and is much lighter. I would ask that the bag strap used to carry an extra bag be re-designed, but the one that came with the Travelpro works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price! 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product, but after first flight with it, the airport/airline roughed it and got oily stains on bag that I couldn’t get out. If you fly a lot like I do, get a darker color.
customer_reviews.author: Vay Launius

customer_reviews.title: Regional Airline Ready
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag for up to a 3 day trip. Excellent carry on for regional flight, fit in the overhead no problem. Just walked right on and off, no gate check, no stress hoping to make my connection.
customer_reviews.author: Banx

customer_reviews.title: USB cord not connected to side pocket
customer_reviews.text: The USB cord for the battery pack was not fed into the side pocket and I had to fish it through myself. Not an easy task for a finished assembled suitcase. Not happy spending $250 and having to finish assembly myself.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shantz

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: It's a good travel bag -but a little large for international travel- moves well but a little heavier than I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and Lighter!
customer_reviews.text: Only just started using it, but it's much lighter and more sophisticated than the 20 year old Travel Pro I had (and loved) previously. That first one lasted hundreds of trips and Thousands of miles and still works very well, but I thought it would be good to update. I expect this new one and I will go and discover many new places together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only 2 wheels 😌
customer_reviews.text: It needs to be dragged because it only has two wheels instead of 4. I gave it to my teen son and even he was disappointed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni E. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This bag had great reviews and it’s perfect for me; however one of the trim pieces on the back pulled loosened the first time I used it
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and stylish
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good well built case and perfect size for overnight maybe two - and able to fit in tighter overhead luggage
customer_reviews.author: BeBo

customer_reviews.title: Good unit. I bet it's my last.
customer_reviews.text: Well built and fits in overhead well. Roller all day for me an cobblestone streets, or in the case of Venice, cobblestone everything.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I’m a flight attendant and Travel Pro is usually my go-to! BUT THIS SUITCASE COSTING ME $200+ the zipper broke on the first day of use.... terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Schuler Schares

customer_reviews.title: Best suitcase ever
customer_reviews.text: I love how smooth the wheels are on the ground. And the soft grip of the handle. The best part is how light this suitcase is and still very durable. Im an Airline crewmember and this bag works great for me
customer_reviews.author: Connor Boettger

customer_reviews.title: Holds a great deal for a travel-on.
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. Love the design, convenient storage setup, holds a great deal for a travel-on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product Have used it for several trips already. Rugged. A good buy
customer_reviews.author: Keith D.

customer_reviews.title: No spinner wheels. Not recommended for frequent travelers.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product based on reviews and recommendations from well-respected sources. After the return date, I realized that it didn’t have spinner wheels. I was deeply disappointed. It seems sturdy besides that, but it made navigating airports, etc much more clumsy for my husband since he could only drag it behind him on its two wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Harding

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, attractive suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: We just went on a three week European vacation. The suitcase held up wonderfully, I couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rodriques

customer_reviews.title: Returned for Tumi
customer_reviews.text: I returned it cause I wanted 4 wheels but was very well made. If it had 4 wheels I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Forward Zipper has been broken only in a few USE
customer_reviews.author: joshua marchena

customer_reviews.title: Got for my husband
customer_reviews.text: he likes it a good color and nice to pack has all kinds of special pockets
customer_reviews.author: Dovie

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, I can get alot of clothing into this luggage for two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy M. Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service & top rated Carry on prodict quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and customer service ! Hope to order another in near future.
customer_reviews.author: E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Well built Carry-on
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase. Some people have written, their suitcase tends to topple over but I don't have that problem. Very content with my purchase. Half the price of some of the brands I considered.
customer_reviews.author: -ich

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, lots of room, but 2 wheels makes it difficult to manuever in tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Bag is high quality and very useful, but 2 wheels make it difficult to navigate in tight areas, like the aisle on an airplane. Also the 2 wheel restriction makes it hard to use while moving in a queue.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet roller!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, should have bought this a long time ago! Love it. Rolls so quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Wirth

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well made. Not cheap, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good looking piece of luggage.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not as large as I thought. However, I like the looks and the various pocket compartments.
customer_reviews.author: L Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Received this item in used condition. Item appeared to be flimsy and cheap
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: replacement
customer_reviews.text: replacing another TravelPro after 12 years, hope this one will hold as well.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Good luggage
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for about 3 months and 20 flights so far, but it's durable. Did not like all the extra thread that gets stuck in the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: If you fly the smaller regional jets, this is a great bag. Easily fit 2 days of clothes with an extra pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Stout

customer_reviews.title: Does not roll as easily as I would prefer
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed this piece only rolls forward making it harder to navigate through airport and down a plane aisle. It is however very roomy and has many compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Christine W

customer_reviews.title: Study two-wheeler!
customer_reviews.text: Great suitcase - as advertised. Not using the charging port... Trying to find a reason to do so
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great quality overall and keeps suits fairly wrinkle free. Great for the business traveler.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Quality of product upon receipt looks good
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice. I leave for my trip this week and will be using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to know but my previous t-pro bag was a warrior
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have another Travelpro carry on and this new model is significantly smaller than my last model.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Layton

product_meta.title: Travelpro Platinum Elite-Softside Expandable Upright Luggage, Bordeaux, Carry-On 22-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Carry-On 22-Inch| Color:BordeauxNever settle. Designed for the traveler who expects top performance without sacrificing style, the 22" expandable carry-on Rollaboard suiter handles short to medium-length trips with polish. Intelligent function comes in a tip-resistant tapered expansion design, built-in wrinkle-resistant suiter and deluxe tie-down system with easy-access accessory pockets, along with a removable, quart-size wet pocket that is TSA compliant and perfect for toiletries. On its exterior, premium fabrics, genuine leather accents, and chrome zippers deliver effortless sophistication, while an adjustable PowerScope extension handle minimizes wobble and keeps you rolling smoothly on two Rollaboard wheels. Built-in USB port lets you power up on the go, while a dedicated powerbank pocket for your back-up battery adheres to faa regulations. This Fit to Fly carry-on rollaboard has been sizer been tested to accommodate overhead bin space on most major US airlines. Fully expanded Carry-On may not meet airline restrictions. Backed by our built for a Lifetime Limited Worry-Free Warranty that covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for the life of the bag after registration under the trusted companion promise.
feature_bullets: Expandable, carry-on Rollaboard suitcase with external USB port and dedicated powerbank pocket meets faa regulations for carry-on and checked baggage. Powerbank not included

High-performance sealed ball bearing wheels ensure a smooth roll and lasting durability. Patented PowerScope airline-grade aluminum extension handle minimizes wobble and has four stops at 36", 38", 40" and 42.5" to accommodate users of different heights

Built-in fold-out suiter keeps clothes wrinkle-free during travel. Deluxe interior tie down system includes built-in accessory pockets for quick access to essentials. Removable quart-sized wet pocket is TSA compliant and perfect for storing toiletries

Backed by our built for a lifetime limited worry free warranty that covers the cost of repair for damage from airline or other common carrier for the life of the bag after registration under the trusted companion promise
Case Dimensions: 21x14x9, Overall Dimensions: 23x14.50x 9 ; Volume : 53.5 L

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars204 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
